Description: Cuirassed bust facing with shield and spear over shoulder. (obverse)
Two emperors flanking cross on steps. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Byzantine Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Byzantine Empire
Bibliographic references: DOC2 / Catalogue of the Byzantine Coins in the Dumbarton Oaks Collection and in the Whittemore Collection (vol. II, Phocas to Theodosius III, 602-717) (Constantine IV, no.6)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2003 22 Mar-12 Oct, Woodbridge, Sutton Hoo Exhibition Centre, Far Fetched Treasures 2015-2016 29 Oct–7 Feb, London, BM, G35, Egypt: faith after the pharaohs.
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Constantine IV
Acquisition name: Purchased through: A H Baldwin & Sons Ltd
